{{infobox character | people=[[Edain|Adan]] | name=Magor | image= | caption= | pronun= | othernames=''Dagorlind'' ([[Sindarin|S]]) | titles= | position=Head of the House of Marach | location=Southern foothills of [[Ered Wethrin]] | affiliation= | language=[[Mannish]] dialect | birth={{FA|341}}{{WJ|14}}, ''The new genealogies of the Edain'', ''(ii) The House of Hador'', p. 234 | birthlocation= | rule={{FA|398}} - unknown | death=after {{FA|398}} (aged 57+) | deathlocation= | age= | notablefor= | house=[[House of Hador|House of Marach]] | parentage=[[Malach Aradan]] & [[Zimrahin]] | siblings=[[Adanel]]
other unnamed siblings{{WJ|14}}, ''The new genealogies of the Edain'', ''(ii) The House of Hador'', p. 233 | spouse= | children=[[Hathol]] | gender=Male | height= | hair= | eyes= | clothing= | weapons= | steed= }} '''Magor''' was a son of [[Malach Aradan]], and the third head of the [[House of Marach]]. ==History== Magor led a part of his [[Folk of Marach|father's people]] away from [[Hithlum]] and southward down the [[Sirion|River Sirion]]. They settled among the southern foothills of the [[Ered Wethrin]],{{S|West}} near the sources of river [[Teiglin]]. Magor's grandson [[Hador]] and his people returned over the mountains and entered the service of the Elven [[Noldorin]] High-king [[Fingolfin]], and Magor's grandson was soon made [[Lord of Dor-lómin]]. From Magor's famous grandson his people took Hador's name and re-named the House of Marach to the [[House of Hador]].{{S|West}} ==Etymology== ''[[Magor (word)|magor]]'' is [[Sindarin]] for "the Swordsman". His epithet '''''Dagorlind''''' means "Singer in Battle", clearly a combination of ''[[dagor]]'' ("battle") + ''[[lind]]'' ("song, music; singer"). ==Genealogy== {{familytree/start}} {{familytree| | | | | | | | | | | | | | | MAR | | |MAR=[[Marach]]

''{{FA|432|n}} - {{FA|503|n}}''}} {{familytree/end}} == Other versions of the legendarium == In later writings, [[Tolkien]] intended to switch places between Magor and [[Hador]], so that Hador was to be the son of Malach Aradan, and Magor (nicknamed ''Dagorlind'') the father of [[Galdor]], [[Gundor]] and [[Glóredhel]]. In that conception, the establishment of the lordship of [[Dor-lómin]] was moved two generations back. However, that change was never properly incorporated in the texts.{{WJ|14}}, ''The new genealogies of the Edain'', ''(ii) The House of Hador'', p. 235{{WJ|14}}, ''Of the Kindreds and Houses of the Edain'', pp. 225-226 {{references}} {{seq-start}} {{seq-head | name=Magor | race=edain | house=[[House of Hador]] | born={{FA|341}} | died=after {{FA|398}} }} {{seq | prow= | pvac= | prev=[[Malach]] | list=3rd Head of the [[House of Hador]] | dates={{FA|398}} - unknown | next=[[Hathol]] | nvac= | nrow= }} {{seq-end}} [[Category:Characters in The Silmarillion]] [[Category:Edain]] [[Category:First Age characters]] [[Category:House of Hador]] [[Category:Rulers in Beleriand]] [[Category:Sindarin names]] [[de:Magor]] [[fi:Magor]] [[fr:encyclo/personnages/hommes/1a/peuple de hador/magor]]
